review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Taoqi is a 4-star Havoc Broadblade wielder that has the option to act as a Hybrid or Support in endgame content, though due to her slow attack animations, low damage and Concerto Energy generation, she is usually forced into the Support role. It is further accentuated by her limited access to her Forte Gauge ability outside of her Intro Skill, which is not always accessible. Fortunately, her Resonance Skill, combined with the occasional use of her Outro that boosts Resonance Skill damage by 38% for next char, allows her to act as a somewhat viable Support.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Resonance Skill emits a pulse around her causing Havoc damage in its radius scaling on her DEF%. This also heals her and summons Rocksteady Shield with 3 charges, where each charge can absorb a single hit from the enemy, reducing damage taken by 15%. This shield is transferable and thus can benefit other characters when you switch.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Forte Gauge can accumulate up to 3 charges, which are generated by consumption or expiry of her Rocksteady Shield charges in a ratio of 1:1. A handy trick to note is that Taoqi’s Basic Attack 4 will consume all her currently active Rocksteady Shield charges regardless of their remaining duration, immediately granting her a full Forte Gauge. She can access and then expend these Forte charges by using a Strategic Parry with her Heavy Attack or Intro Skill to then be able to launch a sequence of enhanced Basic Attacks scaling on her DEF% while generating much more Concerto Energy, Resonance Energy and a team wide shield scaling on her DEF%!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Ultimate Skill deals a large amount of Havoc damage in a cleaving pattern in front of her, which scales on her DEF%. When built as Hybrid, it can hit quite hard but regardless of playstyle its most important utility is Concerto Energy generation for Taoqi.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her field time will vary according to her chosen build. When played as Support, she can spend significantly less time on the field, with the option to situationally weave in her enhanced attacks from her Forte skill at cost of more field time. Alternatively, when played as Hybrid her field time grows significantly to cycle her Concerto properly by factoring in her Forte Gauge combo. The result of this is much easier access to her 38% Resonance Skill amplification compared to when played as a support and proper access to her shielding capabilities tied to her Forte combo. Players must choose between a fast supportive playstyle with limited access to Taoqi’s outro and shielding capabilities or a much slower and dangerous playstyle with full access.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She lands on the easier side of the play difficulty spectrum while being played as support. However, if you are playing her as Hybrid, it will require you to build her Concerto Energy in a timely manner increasing the difficulty due to her slow standard and enhanced Basic Attacks. This has to be done with care so Taoqi doesn’t end up causing the team to lose more damage than she can bring due to hogging the field time.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her preferred choice of set and Echo is the popular combination of Bell-Borne Geochelone Echo & 5P Rejuvenating Glow, which allows her to grant a semi-permanent ATK% boost, temporary DMG% boost and protection from a set number of attacks. In case another character is using the above set or you wish to play her as Hybrid, she can make use of the 5P Moonlit Glow and Impermanence Heron Echo combo instead.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Overall, Taoqi is currently sparsely used in Tower of Adversary, thanks to a multitude of factors the biggest of which are her sluggish gameplay which takes more field time compared to her alternatives, her vulnerability to interruptions and finally her lack of synergistic characters to play alongside. In conclusion Her Support role is easier and takes less field time but restricts access to her Outro amplification , while on the other hand, Hybrid is harder, takes more field time but offers consistent access to not only her Outro amplification but also teamwide shields. Neither of these options are currently popular but as new encounters and characters release Taoqi may find her time to shine.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can apply shields to the entire team when able to execute her Forte combo","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can heal and effortlessly enable the 5P Healer set bonus meaning she doesn’t need to sacrifice her weapon choice like many other supports","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Resonance skill damage reduction buff persists through character switching","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has a powerful Resonance Skill amplification buff Outro","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has the ability to mitigate some damage from big hits with her parry","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

echo_sets.name: Rejuvenating Glow
echo_sets.notes: Offers a 10% unconditional Healing% boost and most importantly a 15% ATK% boost for the entire team, lasting 30 seconds whenever you heal yourself or any of your allies. This bonus can be triggered by the character abilities and weapon effects, is easy to keep active 100% of the time, and is a big help for all party members.

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Verina is a 5-star Spectro Rectifier wielder Support that brings a wide array of buffs and healing utilities for her teammates, making her an indispensable member regardless of your team composition. Contrary to other supports, Verina’s buffs are applied to all of her teammates simultaneously. On top of this, they’re not only easy to trigger, but can also maintain their uptime almost indefinitely. She also has an impressive cheat death mechanic with her Inherent Skill - Grace of Life which can save you in a pinch.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Forte Gauge relies on charge mechanics, allowing her to accumulate up to 4 Photosynthesis Energy charges. These are gained by hitting an enemy with either the 5th part of her Basic Attack, her Intro skill or her Resonance skill. She can then expend these charges to enhance her Mid-Air Attacks or Heavy Attacks, allowing them to heal all allies for a considerable amount while also generating significant amounts of Concerto Energy, which is essential to maximize her supportive capabilities.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Resonance Skill, which deals a mediocre amount of Spectro damage in a range, generates both 30 Concerto Energy and a considerable amount of Resonance Energy. Plus as an added bonus, utilising her Resonance Skill is one of the two easiest and fastest methods for her to generate charges for her Forte Gauge.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Similar to her Resonance Skill, her Ultimate’s damage is nothing to write home about, however it does heal all her allies whilst marking the enemies hit by it with Photosynthesis Mark for 12 seconds. This allows allies attacking marked enemies to trigger an additional attack by Verina for slight damage as well as some healing.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Verina requires minimal time on the field; only enough to conduct her heals, maintain uptime of her buffs and generate the required Concerto Energy for her outro. Despite that, she features not only the best healing capabilities, but also access to a wide array of buffs unmatched by other characters. Combined with her extreme easy to play and master skill set, which only requires managing her Resonance Skill cooldown and Forte Gauge charges, Verina can make combat incredibly forgiving for her teammates, allowing them to take hits without any major concern.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In addition to her healing capabilities, Verina brings unmatched 15% Generic Damage amplification on her Outro Skill, which affects her entire team and lingers even after switching characters - an extremely rare trait among various Outro amplifications present in the game. If all that was not enough, she grants a whopping 20% ATK boost to all characters on the team for 20 seconds whenever she heals! Adding Echo & sets to the mix, Verina prefers a combination of Bell-Borne Geochelone Echo & 5P Rejuvenating Glow set which allows her to grant a semi-permanent ATK% boost, temporary DMG% boost and protection from a set number of attacks. In the instance another character is using the above set, Verina can make use of the 5P Moonlit Glow and Impermanence Heron Echo combo instead.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Overall, Verina is currently one of the most powerful characters in endgame owing to her unmatched Sustain and Support capabilities. This plus her ease of play and low field time requirement makes her stand head and shoulders above her peers in the same role, cementing her place as best Sustain and Support in the game.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

echo_sets.name: Rejuvenating Glow
echo_sets.notes: Offers a 10% unconditional Healing% boost and most importantly a 15% ATK% boost for the entire team, lasting 30 seconds whenever you heal yourself or any of your allies. This bonus can be triggered by the character abilities and weapon effects, is easy to keep active 100% of the time, and is a big help for all party members.

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yangyang is a free 4-star Aero Sword wielder that can function as either a Hybrid or Support in endgame content. While she is capable of dealing some damage, it falls far below other Hybrids, making her much more suitable for a Support role. A","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"s a ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Support character, she has a few things to offer - her Outro skill generates 20 Resonance Energy over 5 seconds for the next character, she also has the ability to inflict CC and gather monsters via her Ultimate and Resonance Skill","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":".","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" Of course when played as a support she can further increase her support utility by utilizing Echo's and Sets with team buffing abilities.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Forte Gauge can accumulate up to 3 charges, which can be generated by using her Resonance Skill, Intro Skill, Heavy Attack, or 4th Basic Attack - the first two being the best generators by far, followed by Heavy, then 4th Basic bringing up the rear. Once full, she can consume them to execute an enhanced Mid-Air attack that can be used through either Heavy Attack sequence or as standard Mid-Air attack. It is by far preferred to use it the second way as it is quicker and can be Swap-Canceled throughout its duration, which is highly recommended. This attack generates massive amounts of Concerto Energy, which is essential for her playstyle regardless of role.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Resonance Skill conjures a small tornado in front of her for a short duration that deals slight damage and functions as small CC and enemy gathering ability (excluding Boss/Elite Monsters), while regenerating her Concerto Energy and filling her Forte Gauge.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Ultimate similarly conjures a cyclone in front of her for a short duration that deals moderate damage and functions as a CC and enemy gathering ability (excluding Boss/Elite Monsters) while regenerating her Concerto Energy.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Once mastered, she can finish her job on field using very little time to execute all she needs, however it does require you to be proficient at Swap-Canceling her Aerial Forte plunge. She features a rather quick Concerto Rotation, which allows other characters to spend more time on field while benefiting from her Outro Skill’s Resonance Energy generation effect. Her small CC and gathering abilities can also be useful sometimes.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She is fairly simple to play, but has moments of vulnerabilities throughout her combo that may cause inexperienced players some grief. To maximize her potential alongside keeping her safe, you will need to keep her Resonance Skill on CD whenever possible to reduce her reliance on execution of Basic & Heavy Attacks to generate Forte Gauge. Furthermore, as mentioned earlier, mastering the Swap-Cancel of Yangyang’s Aerial Forte plunge makes her much safer and effective to play in most teams.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"While her preferred choice of set and Echo is none other than the popular combination of Bell-Borne Geochelone Echo & 5P Rejuvenating Glow, which allows her to grant a semi-permanent ATK% boost, temporary DMG% boost and protection from a set number of attacks. However, in order to activate the set effects, Yangyang must use the Originite: Type II weapon and execute her Ultimate Skill at least once every 30 seconds. In case another character is using the above set, she can make use of the 5P Moonlit Glow and Impermanence Heron Echo combo instead.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Overall, she sees some usage in Tower of Adversary as a Support using either of the support sets, but more often with 5P healer set and healer weapon. She is utilized primarily where her Ultimate & Resonance Skills can disrupt enemies, and much less for bosses where she cannot. Her success is further increased in teams that allow her to Quick-Swap whenever her Resonance Skill is off CD and Swap-Cancel her Aerial Plunge.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Requires reasonably low field time to execute a full Concerto combo","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Outro provides the next character with resonance energy","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can CC and gather enemies slightly with her Ultimate and Resonance skill","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can use a healing weapon to effectively turn her into a Support which synergizes with a lot of the rest of her kit","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Gains great utility and further supportive benefits with Sequences","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She's free!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Not having an amplification buff on Outro puts her in a tough spot against supports and hybrids that do","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Relies heavily on Forte Gauge to execute her fast Concerto rotation which can sometimes be awkward to gain a 3rd charge of quickly","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Mediocre damage potential even when built with damage in mind","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In a weird spot between a Hybrid and Support while not being top tier at either of them","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Yinlin is a 5-star Electro Rectifier wielder who specializes in dealing massive AOE damage without spending much time on the field at all. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She’ll almost always be played alongside another bursty main DPS - preferably one who has incredible Quick Swap potential with abilities that either deal large upfront damage or have long durations that can be swap canceled.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yinlin’s Forte has a passive effect that causes the majority of her abilities to inflict ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Sinner’s Mark","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" which allows her skill’s Execution Mode to deal additional damage. Yinlin’s Forte can also gain Judgement Points from most of her abilities, and, when fully accumulated they can be used to empower her next heavy attack into Chameleon Cipher that converts all Sinner’s Marks on enemies hit into Punishment Marks for 18 seconds that when struck by any ally even if Yinlin leaves the field will take damage up to once per second.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yinlin’s skill comes in two parts:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"the first one will deal AoE Electro damage and activate Execution mode: a special buff she gains for 10 seconds, ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"the second part must be cast shortly after the first and is an AoE electro-damage nuke, ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Execution mode will empower Yinlin’s next 4 Basic Attacks to cause an Electromagnetic Blast when hitting enemies with Sinners Mark, dealing additional damage and generating more Concerto.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This may sound complicated, but once you play Yinlin, her rotation is actually easy to follow and execute. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Considering how much damage Yinlin deals, you might think that she would be a great Main DPS, but it's a trap. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"That's because Yinlin spends very little time on the field when played optimally at the highest level ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"- her rotation is incredibly short - and after you perform it, you would only be left basic attacking, lowering the team's overall damage. It's more optimal to play her in Quick Swap teams with characters like Calcharo, Encore, or Havoc Rover. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"How hard Yinlin is to play will depend on the other damage dealer you pair with her - a combo with Calcharo yields one of the hardest teams to pilot in the game and a pairing with Encore or Havoc Rover will be much easier. In all Yinlin teams, you'll have to master her swap cancel though which might sound tough at first but with a bit of practice becomes second nature.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" Yinlin is a top-tier pick for the Quick Swap dual DPS teams due to how much damage she does, combined with how little on-field time she needs.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yinlin's ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Outro also provides 25% Liberation and 20% Electro Amplification","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" (formerly Deepen) but due to her Quick Swapping nature, this can be tricky to utilize to its maximum potential - and currently, all her best teams belong to the Quick Swap archetype.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As a Hybrid character that allows another damage dealer to take up a larger amount of field time, Yinlin can be expected to make use of the 5P Moonlit Cloud set and Heron Echo. While this set is certainly viable on her, focusing on boosting her damage by equipping the damage dealer set (Void Thunder) is also an insanely strong option - as her damage output is great and the set will boost it even further. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Overall, ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Yinlin is the strongest Hybrid character in the game ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"who is resonably easy to learn and play well, while having multiple different teams where she can be used with great success.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Absurd amounts of damage for how little field time she must spend,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can deal a large chunk of her damage unconditionally while off the field,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Almost all damage she deals is in a gigantic AoE,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Damage is not gated behind long attack sequences and is actually realistic to pull off in most combat scenarios,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can deliver large amounts of burst AoE damage at the start of ToA runs helping to take out annoying small fries.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Some people might not like quick swapping constantly,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Swap canceling might be tricky for some,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Outro currently feels a bit useless due to how she is best in Quick Swap teams,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"You will often get distracted while playing her.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yuanwu is a 4-star Electro Gauntlet wielder Hybrid character who brings more to the table than just damage. His unique Support abilities include a team-wide anti-interruption buff that reduces knockback and stun, and the ability to deal extra break bar damage with his outro, making enemies, particularly bosses, more susceptible to becoming vulnerable.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"With an exceptionally short cooldown of 3 seconds, Yuanwu’s skill summons a Thunder Wedge that creates a large circular aura. The wedge helps Yuanwu generate Forte Gauge, and when enemies within its radius take damage, Yuanwu launches a coordinated attack which can be followed by another one after a cooldown of 1.2 seconds from the attack, dealing DEF-based damage and generating additional Forte Gauge.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yuanwu’s Forte Gauge grants him access to an enhanced charged skill. When executed, it detonates his Thunder Wedge, unleashing a burst of Electro Damage based on his DEF. After using the Forte, Yuanwu enters a self lightning-infused state, enhancing his combat abilities (this state is exclusive to him and does not affect the team). As his Ultimate and Forte-enhanced skill can cause his Thunder Wedge to detonate, players can strategically use his resonance skill placing a Wedge immediately before activating these abilities for extra detonation damage. The primary usage of Yuanwu’s ability is to generate Concerto Energy.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yuanwu’s Ultimate inflicts significant Electro Damage based on his DEF and also grants the entire team a 10-second lightning-infused buff. At S0, this buff provides the entire team an anti-interruption aura reducing the chance they’ll be stunned or knocked back for its duration. Despite Yuanwu’s ultimate buff sharing a name with his Forte Ability buff the two operate quite differently.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yuanwu is designed to spend minimal time on the field, just enough to utilize his Forte Gauge, unleash his Ultimate, and deploy his Thunder Wedge. While players can extend his time on the field to execute lightning-infused attack combos, these typically do not yield as much damage as other options available to the team. Yuanwu’s damage, although modest if skipping his lightning-infused attack, is still reasonable considering his low field time requirement. His standout feature is the anti-interruption buff he provides, which lasts for 10 seconds and his ability to deal extra break bar damage on his outro making certain situations a little easier.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yuanwu is relatively easy to play as a Hybrid character. The key is to maintain his Thunder Wedge on the enemy, use his empowered skill when his Forte is full, and activate his Ultimate as needed.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"It’s important to note Yuanwu’s best abilities scale with DEF% rather than ATK% and he’ll be building with that in mind meaning most typical offensive Echoes that scale on ATK% are less effective for him.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yuanwu’s dependance on DEF makes him more reliant on gear compared to other characters as he gains no base DEF from his weapon or inherent flat DEF from his Echos outside of sub stat rolls. If played with focus on dealing damage, his options are quite limited in the early game due to the majority of his DEF scaling coming from character levels. As an alternative Yuanwu can be played as a support by using the Bell-Borne Geochelone Echo, 5P Rejuvenating Glow Echo set and Originite: Type IV healing weapon. Another option that works for both Support focused or damage focused Yuanwu is using Impermanence Heron Echo with 5P Moonlit Clouds set but at the cost of lower damage.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yuanwu’s potential is still being unearthed with players experimenting with how his unique abilities can be integrated into teams and strategies, currently he isn’t seeing a high amount of play in endgame though.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Takes up very little field time","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Very easy to play and realize his full potential","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can bring much of his benefit while off the field","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Reduces time it takes to stun Boss enemies","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Grants anti-interruption aura to the team","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Gains new supportive abilities with sequences","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"You’ll need to replace his Thunder Wedge often against highly mobile enemies ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Doesn’t bring any offensive buffs as a part of his kit, causing him to fall behind other Hybrid options in total team damage potential","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Scales off Defense instead of Attack making him weaker before max level (weapons and gear don’t grant base Defense)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Acceptable DPS but low total damage making spending any extra field time punishing for overall team output","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Havoc Rover is a free 5-star cleave DPS everyone can gain access to after completing Chapter 6 of the main story quest. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Unlike most Main DPS, Havoc Rover does not specifically need their Ultimate to access most of their combos and instead relies on their Forte Gauge. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Having said that their Ultimate hits like a freight train. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Using the Rover's Intro, Resonance Skill or standard Basic Attacks will grant them a portion of the Forte and once it's full it can be activated to enter a Dark Angel state. Within the state, the Forte Gauge will begin ticking down but while you're in it all your abilities are enhanced. Additionally, you can use your enhanced Resonance Skill to extend the duration of your Dark Angel state, allowing for even more enhanced abilities.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Rovers kit plays out in a builder-spender playstyle that spans roughly 16-18 seconds","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" (when played as a main fielder) which is on the longer side for Main DPS but still acceptable. Their ultimate is strong but not needed, meaning they can switch in and crush whenever needed without downtime making them quite consistent similar to the other Havoc Main DPS Danjin.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"On the surface, Havoc Rover has a fairly simple playstyle consisting almost entirely of a combination of Basic Attacks and Charged Basic Attacks without much room to mess up. However after unlocking Sequence 2 this can be turned on its head for huge gains which we'll get to in a moment. One of the advantages of utilizing a high field time traditional Main DPS rotation, consisting mostly of Basic Attacks is the ability to take better advantage of Deepen abilities such as Sanhua's 38% Basic Attack buff. Rover has not just Sanhua as an option for Deepen but also Danjin who can grant Rover a 23% Havoc Deepen buff.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"After Sequence 2 is unlocked, Havoc Rover ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"gains a tremendous boost to one of their alternative playstyles ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"(shoutout to ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{"uri":"https://www.youtube.com/c/zajef77"},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Zajef","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"hyperlink"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":" for sharing it with us),","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" revolving around extreme burst damage thanks to the Sequence effect immediately resetting the cooldown of their Resonance Skill. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This playstyle is more demanding, but thanks to Sequence 2 can push Rover to much greater heights when executed well. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This playstyle focuses on accumulating Resonance Energy and a portion of Havoc Rover's Forte Gauge with a strategically placed Skill during other characters' rotations - in preparation for an incredibly short insane burst damage sequence. If everything is prepared just right you can Intro into Rover, use your Resonance Skill, Heavy Attack to enter Dark Angel mode, cast your Resonance Liberation then instantly cast your Resonance Skill again, activate your echo Dreamless, and quickly switch cancel out. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"This combo yields truly terrifying burst damage and completely ignores Rover's Forte Gauge duration mechanic in favor of explosive results.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"With Sequence 2 unlocked, you can use either rotation or a combination of both for top-tier performance but within each of them you absolutely should acquire the ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"\"Dreamless\" echo ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"which unlike other echoes is farmed in an instanced dungeon (Statue of the Crownless: Heart) that is unlocked after completing Chapter 6.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As the main character you can expect to get all of Rover's Sequences for free - all of which are useful but some of which substantially increase Rover's damage. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Havoc Rover is a strong, reasonably easy-to-play character with multiple playstyles and team-building options, who will also get a power-up in future patches making them a strong choice.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Easy to play,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Decent damage output,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has an alternative playstyle with one of the strongest burst damage in the game,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Not reliant on Ultimate, ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Multiple support options that amplify their damage, making teambuilding easier,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Free Sequences (but limited to S2 in the 1.0 patch).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

content.value: Changli is a counselor serving the Jinzhou Magistrate, and former Secretary-General in the capital. Shrouded in flames, she's fated to burn brightly until her final embers. With her fiery determination and strategic mindset, she rises to power, always thinking ahead to reach her ultimate goal.

content.value: Jinhsi, Magistrate of Jinzhou, gently brightens the hopes of her people, like rays of winter sunlight. As the revered Sentinel's Appointed Resonator, she displays humility and wholeheartedly commits herself to guiding her people towards a brilliant future.

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Jinshi is a 5-star Spectro Broadblade wielding DPS featuring a unique playstyle with a skIllset centered around managing her special resource with normal and co-ordinated attacks leading to tremendous burst damage. Jinshi is also a user of Aerial combat, albeit much easier than Lingyang thanks to various abilities and quirks she can utilize while airborne. Her unique gameplay consists of repeatedly executing an absurd Cleave burst damage combo every time an ally triggers their Concerto Skill while having their Outro available.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Forte is her core ability, which consists of two parts; firstly, it allows her to generate a unique resource - ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Incandescence ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"- via her own and her allies’ attacks, which she can consume to increase her burst damage. The second part is Incarnation State, an empowered state activated by using her Enhanced Resonance Skill; Overflowing Radiance, which enhances all her abilities. More on this below.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Jinshi can accumulate up to ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"50 Incandescence,","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" all of which can be consumed to immensely increase the damage of her strongest Resonance Skill, Luminous Epiphany. Higher counts of Incandescence unsurprisingly leads to higher damage. She can gain Incandescence in following ways:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"1 stack of Incandescence every time any teammate deals damage, with a cooldown of 3 seconds,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"2 stacks of Incandescence every time an ally launches a coordinated attack, with a separate cooldown of 3 seconds.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"These two effects can be triggered simultaneously by a single coordinated attack, allowing her to gain 3 Incandescence every 3 seconds. What’s more, she can trigger these cooldowns once per Elemental type in the team composition, allowing her to generate 3 Incandescence every 3 seconds per Elemental type (Electro, Spectro, Fusion etc). This makes teams with multiple coordinated attackers of different Elemental types optimal for her. Upon performing her Outro skill, she receives a buff reducing the cooldown of both abilities to 1 second from 3 second, facilitating even faster generation of Incandescence.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Incarnation ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"is an essential part of Jinshi’s kit and triggering it sends you airborne similar to Lingyang’s Ultimate. However, unlike Lingyang’s Ultimate, it’s much stronger and easier to control, and most importantly, the majority of her abilities can be used while flying. The optimal play would be spending all of your field time within the Incarnation state, which is relatively easy, owing to Overflowing Radiance having a cooldown of a mere 12 seconds. Jinshi gains access to her most potent combos and abilities in this state, especially her Enhanced Basic Attacks and 2nd and 3rd Enhanced Resonance Skill, making it the obvious best option for her.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Jinshi’s Resonance Skill features 4 different variants (the most out of any character in the game) - 1 Standard version and 3 Enhanced versions - with each of them being able to cast in succession, assuming conditions are met. While it seems intimidating on paper, it is actually quite easy when actually playing her. A quick summary of the skills:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Default Resonance Skill","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":": Jinshi’s default Resonance Skill can be activated without any conditions. It deals Spectro damage accompanied by a small dash, has a cooldown of 3 seconds, and is almost never used as a part of her standard rotations (thus, you can ignore worrying about it).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Overflowing Radiance","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":": Jinshi’s first Empowered Resonance Skill requires you to perform the 4th attack of her Unenhanced Basic Attack combo or use her Intro ability. Using it deals Spectro damage and allows Jinshi to enter the Incarnation state. It has a cooldown of 12 seconds and is her bread and butter, making you want to keep this ability on cooldown at all times if possible.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Crescent Divinity","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":": Jinshi’s second Empowered Resonance Skill requires her to be in the Incarnation state to utilize it. Using it deals a strong amount of Spectro damage with a cooldown of 10 seconds, and is almost always used immediately after entering the Incarnation state. You can think of this ability as Part 2 of Overflowing Radiance as they’re always used together.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Luminous Epiphany","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":": Jinshi’s third and last Empowered Resonance Skill requires her to perform the 4th attack of her Enhanced Incarnation Basic Attack while in the Incarnation state. Using it deals an immense amount of Spectro damage, consuming all of Jinshi’s accumulated Incandescence stacks to deal even more damage. This should only be used once per rotation and is almost always the final attack she uses before switching out.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This flow of skills is basically what Jinshi’s playstyle is all about, before taking into account her Echo or Ultimate Skill. Trigger Jinshi’s Intro skill to gain access to Overflowing Radiance, then use it followed by Crescent Divinity, 4 Enhanced Basic Attacks, and finally Luminous Epiphany before switching out.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Ultimate skill deals massive Spectro damage in a cleave attack. While it generates a good amount of Concerto Energy, it costs a whopping 150 Resonance Energy to cast. Her Ultimate should be utilized as soon as available to prevent Resonance Energy wastage and it can be uniquely casted while Airborne, something incredibly relevant when utilizing her Forte Gauge.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She has a particularly large field time requirement due to constantly doing swap-ins to deal short bursts of damage, since her potential is tied to starting off her rotation with an Intro Skill then triggering Resonance skills as soon as they are off cooldown to build Concerto quickly on allies. Despite sounding complicated, Jinshi is extremely easy to play with only the considerations being who to swap in after her rotation completion, maximizing teammates Concerto generation, and coordinated attacks uptime.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Owing to her unmatched cleave damage and one of the best, if not the best Single Target damage, Jinshi stands at top of the meta in its current state. It is further boosted by a diverse choice of teammates she can work amicably with, allowing anyone to make good use of her. All she really wants is teammates that are capable of coordinated attacks, preferably of different Elemental types. Featuring a complex but easy to execute kit and rotation, she exhibits great future potential and redeems aerial combat in a big way. Her kit has more than what we have just mentioned in this review - which you should familiarize yourself with by checking out her team building synergies and rotation page.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"While airborne in the Incarnation state Jinshi can avoid many types of attacks from enemies, reducing the chance she'll be hit even though her movement is restricted.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Many of her attacks feature dashing components which can often result in bosses and monsters missing you even without the need to dodge.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Despite spending much of her time in the air due to all her dashes and semi-ranged attacks she does not struggle in gameplay unlike Lingyang.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredibly easy and simple to play for how much damage she deals.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Some of the highest burst and sustained damage in the game.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has room to grow in the future as new coordinated attackers are released.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Always has an Outro ready thanks to her special ability Eras in Unity.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her best damage combos all require her to perform an Intro (not hard to play around but a small restriction).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"While in the Incarnation state and airborne, Jinshi is more prone to taking damage than other characters during her rotation.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Prefers to be played with coordinated attackers as both her teammates, limiting her current potential partners somewhat (although she still has incredible options).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

content.value: Zhezhi is a commissioned painter, quiet and shy with a dedication to her craft. She's not very eloquent, but her persistence and love for painting speak volumes.

Huaxu Academy's Principal Investigator, Xiangli Yao, displays exceptional expertise in various research fields despite his young age. He is a gentle yet rational soul, embracing unique insights and commitment to the research of Automata Mechanics.

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Xiangli Yao is a 5-star Electro Gauntlet wielder who specializes in unleashing strong combos during his Ultimate burst window. What sets him apart from other Ultimate-focused characters, is his unusually long burst duration. This generous window allows for Dodging, Swapping, and even a few mistakes, making his gameplay more forgiving and accessible. Additionally, Xiangli Yao gains Interruption Resistance while his Ultimate buff is active, eliminating one of the most frustrating issues faced by burst-centric characters: being interrupted mid-combo. This resistance significantly reduces his reliance on Swap-Cancels—a challenge that troubles some of his counterparts like Calcharo. To better grasp his abilities and unlock his full potential, let’s dive into his kit.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As an Ultimate-centric character, Xiangli Yao largely overlooks his non-Ultimate abilities in favor of quickly gaining access to his Ultimate. However, there is one exception - the Resonance Skill: Deduction. This ability delivers an Electro attack that generates a substantial amount of Concerto/Resonance energy, is Swap-Cancellable, and has an impressively short cooldown of just 5 seconds. Xiangli Yao's main combo falls slightly short of producing the required 100 Concerto to consistently execute his Outro. To bridge this gap, weaving in one or two uses of Deduction during your team’s rotations is highly advised. This not only ensures smooth combo execution but also contributes to additional Resonance energy.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Xiangli Yao’s Ultimate Cognition Model is heart of his kit. Upon activation, Xiangli Yao summons a large cube projection, delivering substantial Electro damage while generating a significant amount of Concerto and placing him into the Intuition buffed state for 24 seconds. During this phase, all his abilities—Basic Attack, Resonance Skill, Dodge Counter, Heavy Attack, and Mid-Air Attack—are enhanced, alongside his Forte gauge. One of the key elements introduced by the Ultimate is the acquisition of 3 charges of Hypercube - it's a unique resource that fuels a powerful attack - Law of Reigns. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Your goal after activating Xiangli Yao’s Ultimate and entering the Intuition state is not to perform as many enhanced attacks within the 24-second duration as possible but, instead to focus on expending all 3 of his Hypercube charges on Laws of Reign as fast as possible - as doing this will lead to the most damage per second. Additionally after consuming all 3 charges of Hypercube the Intuition buffed state will end regardless of the remaining duration ready for you to recharge it and repeat the 3 cube burst combo again.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Xiangli Yao’s Forte Gauge is up next and he actually has access to two of them - one of which is essential to his gameplay (Ultimate empowered) and the other of which can be mostly ignored (Standard).  ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"His first and standard Forte Gauge is active whenever his Ultimate buffed state is not and is called “Capacity”. Whenever Xiangli Yao uses his standard Resonance Skill or Basic Attacks he generates capacity rapidly and after accumulating a full Forte Gauge worth of it his Resonance Skill -  Deduction is replaced with Resonance Skill - Decipher, which deals more damage and has a separate cooldown. Decipher generates the same Concerto energy and similar Resonance Energy to Deduction and doesn’t directly aid Xiangli Yao with his game plan. For this reason, the standard Forte Gauge is mostly irrelevant and can be treated as a bit of bonus damage whenever it fills. Sometimes some of your Deductions you use to generate Concerto and Resonance energy will be converted to Deciphers but you should treat them the same and still Swap-Cancel them as fast as possible to focus on his Ultimate instead. \nXiangli Yao’s second Forte Gauge can only be accessed after using his Ultimate Cognition Model and while the Intuition buff remains active. While the Ultimate enhanced Forte Gauge is in effect Xiangli Yao’s Capacity gauge is upgraded into “Performance Capacity” which converts it into a 5-point charge system that can be accumulated by landing hits with any of his Ultimate enhanced abilities. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As mentioned earlier Xiangli Yao’s goal during his Ultimate is to consume all 3 of his Hypercube charges as fast as possible by executing 3 Laws of Reign attacks. The catch to this is that Laws of Reign requires and consumes 5 Performance Capacity charges in order to activate. This means your updated mission now is to generate 5 Performance Capacity and spend it on Laws of Reign 3 times as fast as you can. To do this you’ll want to execute the series of enhanced abilities which generates 5 Performance Capacity as fast as possible while also dealing as much damage as possible. The best combo to do this is by combining Xiangli Yao’s Ultimate enhanced Resonance Skill - Divergence to jump into the air followed by his enhanced Mid-Air Attack - Revamp, you of course want to follow this with Laws of Reign.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ultimate: Skill: Divergence (Builds 2 Performance Capacity)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Forte: Mid-Air Atk: Revamp (Builds 3 Performance Capacity)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Forte: Skill: Law of Reigns (Consumes 5 Performance Capacity)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"That’s 1 Cube down and 2 to go but there’s an issue - while the above combo is the most efficient in terms of time, damage, and resource generation Divergence has a 7-second cooldown so we can’t just spam it 3 times in a row. To solve this we need to weave in one more combo that’s the next most efficient and that is making use of Xiangli Yao’s enhanced 3-part Basic Attack combo. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ultimate: Basic: Pivot - Impale P1 (Builds 1 Performance Capacity)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ultimate: Basic: Pivot - Impale P2 (Builds 2 Performance Capacity)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ultimate: Basic: Pivot - Impale P3 (Builds 2 Performance Capacity)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Forte: Skill: Law of Reigns (Consumes 5 Performance Capacity)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"After executing the Basic Attack combo the Divergence combo should be back off cooldown to use for the third and final cube. After spending your last cube the Ultimate will immediately end and you’ll be back to the start of using a few Deductions in between your other teammates abilities to generate Resonance energy and Concerto until your Ultimate is ready to go once again.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Additionally, while performing Xiangli Yao’s Ultimate combos, you will have ample time to incorporate Dodge Counters or Character Swaps - and all generate extra Performance Capacity. Ultimate-enhanced Dodge Counters, in particular, generate 2 Performance Capacity. If these additional charges are available, you can choose to either continue with the standard combo or integrate them, thus skipping some portions of the usual Performance Capacity building sequences to accelerate the burst process.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Xiangli Yao's Inherent Skills significantly improve his performance, providing both offensive and defensive advantages. His first inherent skill grants a stackable Electro DMG% boost whenever a Resonance skill is used, accumulating up to four stacks. Each stack provides a 5% damage increase, and the effect lasts for 8 seconds. Given that Xiangli Yao frequently employs Resonance Skills—Deduction, Decipher, Divergence, and Law of Reigns—this buff will remain active throughout most of his combo. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The second Inherent Skill serves as a defensive tool, granting Xiangli Yao Interruption Resistance while the Intuition State is active. This ability is vital, as many of Xiangli Yao’s powerful attacks come with long animations. Without this skill, he would need to rely on Swap-Cancels, much like Calcharo. However, with this ability, Xiangli Yao can execute his attacks freely, without the constant concern of being interrupted mid-combo, allowing for smoother and uninterrupted gameplay.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Xiangli Yao is a great Electro-damage dealer, offering a level of accessibility that surpasses many other Ultimate-buff-based characters, without compromising on raw damage potential. His versatile and well-rounded kit makes him a reliable choice, with strong team synergies available right from his release. One of his greatest advantages is his accessibility, as he is available for free for some time after his initial banner drops (during the 1.2 patch). His easy-to-learn playstyle combined with his potent damage output makes him a standout option in his role.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

content.value: The Shorekeeper of the Black Shores, a mysterious divine being governing the essence of aloofness, emerges in response to your summon. Having spent eons in guardianship, the first stirrings of emotion and desire awaken within her heart, fostering a firm determination to connect with the world — and with you.

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"The Shorekeeper is a 5-star Spectro Rectifier wielder specializing in healing and supporting her allies.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" She shares a similar role to Verina and can similarly fit in almost any team composition. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Her unique aspect is her buffs being CRIT-based","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" instead of Attack%, which usually allows her to outperform Verina in the raw damage multiplication department (excluding other synergies). However, unlike Verina, ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"she must follow a strict rotation as her buffing capabilities are entirely tied to her Resonance Liberation and Outro","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". This isn’t a bad thing, but understanding how to achieve it efficiently and consistently is very important if you want to use The Shorekeeper to her full potential. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Now let's dive into her kit. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Her Resonance Liberation: End Loop has an activation cost of whopping 175 Energy.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" Upon its use, she summons the Stellarealm for 30 seconds - a massive ring providing benefits to allies within its radius and generating Shorekeeper 20 Concerto Energy upon activation. Stellarealm features 3 different stages with each offering a benefit that can stack with each other. The initial summon will be in “Outer Stellarealm” variant, but whenever an ally executes an Intro skill within its bounds, it is upgraded to the next stage. The 3 stages are: ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Outer Stellarealm (Baseline) ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"- Continuously Heal all allies once every 3 seconds.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Inner Stellarealm (After 1 Intro)","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" - Increases 0.01% Critical Rate per 0.2% of Shorekeeper’s Energy Regeneration up to 12.5% for all allies.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Supernal Stellarealm (After 2 Intro)","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" - Increases 0.02% Critical Damage per 0.1% of Shorekeeper’s Energy Regeneration up to 25% for all allies.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"After using 2 Intros, ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"your party gains Continuous Healing, 12.5% Critical Rate and 25% Critical Damage for the duration of Stellarealm.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" To achieve this though, you’ll need to ensure The Shorekeeper is built with enough Energy Regeneration - the magic number being 250% (150% from Echoes, Weapon, and Passives). Additionally, the 250% Energy Regeneration is a comfortable checkpoint to ensure her timely access to her Ultimate in most team set-ups as well. As her Resonance Liberation features a 25-second cooldown, with careful planning you should have no trouble maintaining its uptime for most of the fight. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Her other key supportive ability is her Outro, which grants the entire party a 15% Damage Amplification buff for 30 seconds,","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" regardless of how many times they Swap In-or-Out. As an added bonus, whenever the On-Field Resonator is launched/knocked back, you can immediately recover and execute Perfect Dodge followed by a Dodge Counter by tapping the Dodge button. However, this effect is limited to 5 times per application. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"These two abilities form the core of her kit and are the focus of everything she will aim to achieve on the field. The game plan is simple: ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"generate as much as Concerto Energy as fast as possible, ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"summon the Stellarealm and then immediately perform her Outro triggering another character's Intro to upgrade the realm immediately and apply Shorekeeper’s Outro buff,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"after which you only require 1 more Intro to fully upgrade the realm. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Fortunately, the rest of her kit is competent at generating Concerto quickly, so let's take a look at that. Her Forte Circuit: Astral Chord is divided into two different charge-based resources - “Collapsed Cores” and “Empirical Data”.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"“Collapsed Cores","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"” are glowing orbs that materialize on the field when triggered and are generated by the use of any of her standard Basic Attacks. These Cores transform into “Flare Star Butterflies” after 6 seconds of spawn - a homing missile attack targeting the closest enemy dealing small damage but generating good Concerto Energy. She can only have 5 Cores active at once, with additional Cores transforming the oldest Core into a Butterfly ignoring the 6-second rule. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"“Empirical Data”","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" also features a 5 charge limit and is generated via her Basic Attacks, but can be only used once you have accumulated all 5, enhancing her next Heavy Attack of Mid-Air Attack, consuming all charges and gaining the following effects: ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Enhanced Mid-Air Attack: Forte Transmutation","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" - Deals Spectro damage, generates good Concerto Energy, and converts all “Collapsed Cores” into “Flare Star Butterflies” instantly and can be followed up by Basic Attack 2.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Enhanced Heavy Attack: Forte Illation","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" - Deals Spectro damage, generates good Concerto Energy, converts all “Collapsed Cores” into “Flare Star Butterflies” instantly, and slightly pulls Non Elite/Boss enemies to the center of the ability gathering them.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Both abilities are similar, but Forte Illation is preferred as it doesn’t require you to be in Mid-Air and also features Pull, as such use it whenever you have 5 “Empirical Data” to generate additional Concerto Energy and expedite the conversion of “Collapsed Cores” into Concerto generating “Flare Star Butterflies”. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"To activate these Forte Abilities, we will need to use her Basic Attacks - mainly her standard 4 Basic Attack combo, which is:  ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack 1 (Generates 1 “Collapsed Cores” and 1 “Empirical Data”)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack 2 (Generates 1 “Collapsed Cores” and 1 “Empirical Data”)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack 3 (Generates 1 “Collapsed Cores” and 2 “Empirical Data”)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack 4 (Generates 1 “Collapsed Cores” and 1 “Empirical Data”)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The combo generates enough “Empirical Data” and “Collapsed Cores” to immediately follow up with an enhanced Forte attack of your choice (Illation recommended) after which all Cores will convert to “Flare Star Butterflies” generating a burst of Concerto Energy. Furthermore, her Dodge Counter also generates strong Concerto Energy but should be only utilized if a situation arises. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Shorekeeper’s Resonance Skill isn’t overly connected to the rest of her kit but is an excellent tool for a burst of healing and concerto generation. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Using it grants 20 Concerto energy immediately, heals the party for a decent amount instantly, and summons 5 “Dim Star Butterflies” which operate identically to “Flare Star Butterflies”. Overall, the ability grants 30 Concerto after the butterflies find their target and only has a 16-second cooldown - use it whenever it’s available and you aren’t full on concerto. As a bonus using Basic Attacks right after this ability will skip straight to Basic Attack 2 of the combo. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Lastly let's talk about The Shorekeeper's Intro skill, which she has two of - a standard one and an empowered one accessible only once per Resonance Liberation used.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" Both Intro skills heal, deal damage, and generate good Concerto Energy, but the empowered one does it all better at the cost of immediately ending the current Stellarealm regardless of the duration left. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This might look like a steep cost to pay, but when played optimally you should be only switching Shorekeeper in when she needs to refresh the Stellarealm anyway, making this downside negligible. On the upside, empowered Intro generates double Concerto Energy, deals damage based on her HP instead of Attack (resulting in a surprisingly large damage nuke), always hits Critically, and heals slightly more. With all these bonuses, you should always aim to execute the empowered Intro if possible, and the damage dealt is non-negligible if you decide to build into it. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Rounding off her kit is her Inherent Skills:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The first offers the standard ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Cheat Death","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" ability we expect from healing characters protecting a fatally wounded ally by transferring half of Shorekeeper’s HP to it instead. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The second one grants Shorekeeper ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"10% additional Energy Regen","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" while any Resonator is within the Stellarealm radius (counting towards the 250% Bonus) meaning you only need to get 240% now! As an extra bit of flavor, if Rover is in the team, they too gain the 10% Energy Regeneration bonus. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In conclusion,","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":" Shorekeeper has a packed-to-the-brim supportive kit with excellent healing capabilities","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" but she has a strong reliance on Concerto Energy generation tools such as her Intro and the weapons - Variation or Stellar Symphony (her Signature), without which she will feel less smooth. This can lead to her having weak openers in endgame modes lacking immediate Intro access - such as Tower of Adversity, and longer rotations for those lacking either weapon option. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"However, if you are able to overcome these limitations, she is absolutely a meta powerhouse featuring some of the best supportive capabilities and flexibility in the game. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Unique and incredible Critical Rate and Critical Damage buffs.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Tremendous continuous healing for the whole team.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Full team Damage Amplification that isn’t lost on switching.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Excellent carrier of the Rejuvenating Glow set.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Deals surprisingly high damage with the empowered Intro (if built with it in mind).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredibly flexible - can be played in many different teams.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

content.value: Youhu, a natural expert in identifying antiques, is a capable speaker with distinctive tastes. When dealing with treasures and antiques, this jubilant dynamo settles into calm perception, tracing their distant past through their wrinkles and textures.
